Description:
Responsible for ensuring the implementation of QC system and certifications.
English is the primary language, and Arabic is an added advantage
Maintaining all records for external audits and clearing external audits
Conducting internal audits
Conducting QA-related training programmes for employees
Communicating with government food control authorities like SFDA
Upgrading the quality certifications and being part of NPD to support QA-related inputsSkills
Skills:
Understanding of Local Regulations: Familiarity with Saudi Arabia's food safety and quality regulations, including those set by the Saudi Food and Drug Authority (SFDA), is crucial. Ensuring compliance with these regulations is essential for the import, sale, and distribution of FMCG products in the country.
Halal Certification: Many FMCG products in Saudi Arabia require Halal certification, especially for food and beverage items. Knowledge of Halal standards and the certification process is essential.
Cultural Sensitivity: Understanding and respecting Saudi Arabian cultural norms and business practices is important for effective communication and relationship-building with local stakeholders.
Arabic Language Proficiency: While English is widely used in business, having proficiency in Arabic can be a significant advantage for communication, especially when dealing with local suppliers and authorities.
Local Supplier Relations: Building and maintaining good relationships with local suppliers is vital in Saudi Arabia's FMCG industry. This includes negotiating contracts and managing the quality of incoming materials.
Islamic Finance Knowledge: Familiarity with Islamic finance principles can be beneficial, especially if your role involves financial aspects related to quality control operations.
Hiring and Managing Local Talent: If you are in a leadership role, the ability to recruit, train, and manage Saudi nationals in your team can be important, as there is an emphasis on Saudization in the Saudi job market.
Crisis Management: Being prepared for potential crises or disruptions, such as food recalls or quality issues, and having a well-defined crisis management plan that aligns with local requirements is critical.
Local Market Understanding: Understanding consumer preferences, market trends, and competitive dynamics in the Saudi FMCG market can help in making informed decisions regarding product quality and development.
Cross-Cultural Communication: Effective communication skills to bridge cultural gaps and work collaboratively with a diverse workforce and business partners.
Sustainability Initiatives: Saudi Arabia has been increasingly focusing on sustainability and environmental initiatives. Being aware of and contributing to these efforts can be a positive aspect of your role.
Government Relations: Establishing and maintaining good relations with government authorities and agencies responsible for regulating the FMCG sector is important for smooth operations.
Supply Chain Management: Understanding the intricacies of the Saudi supply chain, including logistics, transportation, and warehousing, can help in optimizing quality control processes.
